page.title: 17INTERVIEW WITH A LIBRARIAN
page.content: We visited Treharris Library to ask Miss Davies, (the librarian), some questions. As a result of these questions, we were able to discover the following information. The library is open six days a week with the busiest days being Wednesday and Friday. We were told there were approximately 13644 books in the library and new books arrive each week by van. We asked about losses and Miss Davies said very few. Three hundred books go out each week we also were told that there were regular readers each day of the newspapers on display. People also came in for a chat. Miss Davies thought that children did not use the library enough. Finally we asked the librarian was there ever any change in the number of people using the library. She said there had been an increase during the miners strike.
